docs.lead_paragraph: Also lifting stocks was the strong acceptance by private creditors of Greece’s bond swap offer, but gains were held in check.

headline.seo: Markets Slightly Higher After Jobs Report
headline.main: Shares Rise on Jobs Report But End With Slight Gains
headline.print_headline: Shares Rise on Jobs Report But End With Slight Gains

docs.abstract: Stocks close with modest gains after the government’s monthly report on employment bolsters hopes that the economic recovery is on track; gains are tempered by news that a big debt write-down by Greece could cause significant losses for some banks.
docs.snippet: Also lifting stocks was the strong acceptance by private creditors of Greece’s bond swap offer, but gains were held in check.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has appointed Todd Park to be his top technology adviser, the White House announced on Friday. Mr. Park will become the chief technology officer for the executive branch, filling one of two vacancies left in the Office of Science and Technology Policy by Aneesh Chopra, who returned to the Advisory Board Company in February. Mr. Park has been the chief technology officer in the Department of Health and Human Services since the position was created in August 2009. He was responsible for modernizing the department's data infrastructure, and led the development of Health.gov, an online directory of public and private health insurance plans, and Health.Data.gov, an public inventory of the agency's data sets.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama appoints Todd Park to succeed Aneesh Chopra as his top technology adviser; Park has been the chief technology officer in the Department of Health and Human Services. (S)
docs.snippet: President Obama has appointed Todd Park to be his top technology adviser,  the White House announced on Friday.     Mr. Park will become the chief technology officer for the executive branch, filling one of two vacancies left in the Office of Science...

docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL     CRITICS SAY JAPAN IGNORED WARNINGS OF DISASTER

docs.abstract: Todd Park will become the nation's chief technology officer, replacing Aneesh Chopra, who left in February after three years in the post.

headline.main: Job Strength in Health Care and Energy

docs.abstract: Republicans say Obama policies cost jobs. Employment numbers say otherwise, at least in health care and oil drilling.
docs.snippet: Republicans say Obama policies cost jobs. Employment numbers say otherwise, at least in health care and oil drilling.

docs.lead_paragraph: There has been a growing appreciation among many Italians that the government is deadly serious in countering what is considered one of the chief scourges of Italian society: a failure to declare taxes.

headline.main: Tax Cheats Become Italy’s Public Enemy
headline.print_headline: Italy Intensifies Its All-Out War on Tax Evaders

docs.abstract: Italian officials have opened a new, all-out war against tax evaders, hoping to close Italy’s $2.5 trillion public debt and revive a frail economy that has been buffeted by the euro crisis; in addition to banning cash transactions, it has included an ad campaign comparing tax evaders to parasites.
docs.snippet: There has been a growing appreciation among many Italians that the government is deadly serious in countering what is considered one of the chief scourges of Italian society: a failure to declare taxes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure.

headline.seo: White House Works to Shape Debate Over Health Law
headline.main: White House Works to Shape Debate Over Health Law
headline.print_headline: White House Set To Shape Debate Over Health Law

docs.abstract: White House begins an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure, which is seen as Pres Obama’s signature legislative achievement; officials summon dozens of leaders of nonprofit organizations that strongly back the law to help them coordinate plans for a prayer vigil, press conferences and other events outside the court when justices hear arguments beginning March 26.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans want to kill the board charged with controlling Medicare spending, but the board is a needed buffer between Congress and health care lobbies.

headline.seo: Weren’t House Republicans Worried About Medicare Costs?
headline.main: We Thought They Were Worried About Costs
headline.print_headline: We Thought They Were Worried About Costs

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes House Republicans for trying to kill off an independent board that is supposed to help rein in federal spending on Medicare, as part of their broader campaign to repeal health care reform; argues board is a needed buffer between Congress and the powerful health care lobbies that drive up spending.
docs.snippet: Republicans want to kill the board charged with controlling Medicare spending, but the board is a needed buffer between Congress and health care lobbies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The practices of doctors who treat high numbers of the reported 320,000 low-income Texans who are dually eligible for Medicare and Medicaid are suffering.

headline.seo: Texas Limits Are Squeezing the Elderly Poor and Their Doctors
headline.main: State Cuts Squeezing the Elderly Poor and Their Doctors
headline.print_headline: State Cuts Squeezing The Elderly Poor And Their Doctors

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry said Texas will step in if the federal government cuts financing over the state’s opposition to Planned Parenthood.

headline.seo: Perry Pledges to Finance Texas Medicaid Women’s Health Program
headline.main: Perry Pledges to Finance Texas Women’s Health Program
headline.print_headline: Perry Pledges to Finance Texas Women’s Program

docs.abstract: Gov Rick Perry, responding to intensifying criticism about the Texas government’s decision to exclude Planned Parenthood from a health care program for low-income women, announces that the state would use its own money to operate the program if Washington follows through on threats to cease financing.
docs.snippet: Gov. Rick Perry said Texas will step in if the federal government cuts financing over the state’s opposition to Planned Parenthood.
